chunks.title: Rules
chunks.chunkText:
## Rules
- Prefer Set-StrictMode -Version Latest in scripts you control.
- Use $ErrorActionPreference = "Stop" for fail-fast automation.
- Use Join-Path over manual path concatenation.
- Quote paths with spaces.

chunks.title: Common project ops
chunks.chunkText:
## Common project ops
- Repo search: Get-ChildItem -Recurse -Filter *.ts
- Grep: Select-String -Path .\src\*.ts -Pattern "TODO" -Recurse
- JSON: Get-Content file.json | ConvertFrom-Json
- Invoke: & .\script.ps1 -Arg value

chunks.title: Gotchas
chunks.chunkText:
## Gotchas
- ExecutionPolicy on new machines
- Backticks vs quotes, line continuation
- PowerShell vs CMD escaping for curl/json

chunks.title: Common pitfalls
chunks.chunkText:
## Common pitfalls

- Forgetting to `await` coroutines: you get a coroutine object, not the result.
- Mixing sync and async: avoid blocking calls inside async def; use `run_in_executor` if needed.
- Not closing the event loop or not using `async with` for resources.

chunks.title: Fixing async bugs
chunks.chunkText:
## Fixing async bugs

1. Ensure all async functions are defined with `async def` and called with `await`.
2. Use `asyncio.run()` at the top level to start the event loop.
3. Prefer `async with` for aiohttp, aiofiles, and other async context managers.

chunks.title: Testing async code
chunks.chunkText:
## Testing async code

- Use `pytest-asyncio` and mark tests with `@pytest.mark.asyncio`.
- Or use `asyncio.run()` inside a sync test to run a single coroutine.

chunks.title: index
chunks.chunkText:
RULE_TEST_UNIQUE: Prefer asyncio.run() at top-level; avoid nested event loops.

RULE_TEST_UNIQUE: Prefer asyncio.run() at top-level; avoid nested event loops.
